data.title: 40+ States Could Join Antitrust Lawsuit Against Facebook
data.text: Facebook could soon be staring down a lawsuit as the Federal Trade Commission and numerous states attorneys general finish up one or more antitrust cases against the social media giant, Reuters reports. One source told Reuters that FTC staff has recommended that commissioners sue Facebook in federal court so as to let a group of […]

data.title: Facebook probe in final stages as FTC, U.S. states prepare lawsuits
data.text: The Federal Trade Commission and a bipartisan group of dozens of state attorneys general are in the final stages of filing one or more major antitrust complaints against Facebook Inc in early December, according to four sources familiar with the situation.

data.title: Report: States, FTC Set To Sue Facebook Over Acquisitions Of Instagram, WhatsApp
data.text: Federal and state investigators are examining if the acquisitions left users with less choice and worse privacy protections.

data.title: Facebook: AI software eliminated 95% of hate speech
data.text: “A central focus of Facebook's AI efforts is deploying cutting-edge machine learning technology to protect people from harmful content,” Facebook Chief Technical Officer Mike Schroepfer says.

data.title: Facebook claims A.I. now detects 94.7% of the hate speech that gets removed from its platform
data.text: Facebook says artificial intelligence software now detects 94.7% of the hate speech that gets removed from its platform.

data.title: Facebook defends decision to bring content moderators back to offices despite Covid-19 risks
data.text: Facebook executives on Thursday defended the company's decision to bring content moderators back into offices in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: EU digital chief to talk to tech giants over rules to curb their power
data.text: The European Union's digital chief has invited companies including Alphabet , Apple , Amazon and Facebook to video talks next week to discuss draft rules to curb their powers, an EU official said on Thursday.

data.title: Exclusive: Vietnam threatens to shut down Facebook over censorship requests - source
data.text: Vietnam has threatened to shut down Facebook in the country if it does not bow to government pressure to censor more local political content on its platform, a senior official at the U.S. social media giant told Reuters.

data.title: EU auditors see uphill battle for EU antitrust regulators versus big tech
data.text: EU antitrust enforcers face an uphill battle in tackling tech giants abusing their dominance because of the difficulty of finding remedies, the EU's budget watchdog said on Thursday in its first audit of the regulators.
